Data.Title: Future Be able to
Data.Description: Use to express if we can do something in the future (Will can NO!!)
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Afirmative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will + be able to + verb infinitive</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Negative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will not (won't) + be able to  + verb infinitive</color>
R03:<color=#5bd3de>Question:</color><color=#c9e8ff> Will + 'Suj' + be able to + verb infinitive + '?'</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:She will be able to get tickets if she gets to the box office early.
R01:Tom will be able to come over if he leaves the office early.
R01:You’ll be able to change a flat tire as long as you have a jack.
R01:We’ll be able to go camping next week unless it is not raining bucketing down.
R02:She won’t be able to come to Tim’s leaving party if she doesn’t make up with Susan.
R02:We won’t be able to pass the exam even if we study all night long.
R02:I won’t be able to do any exercise unless Peter gives me my bike back.
R02:As she left her fancy costume, she won’t be able to wear it.
R03:Will he able to beat her if he doesn’t play well?
R03:If nobody helps you to tidy this mess, will you be able to tidy it by yourself?
R03:Will people be able to turn invisible sometime in the future?
R03:Do you think Javier will be able to make it to Bill’s book launch party?
SpanishExamples: Podrá conseguir tickets si llega pronto a la taquilla.
Tom podrá venir a casa si sale de la oficina pronto.
Podrás cambiar una rueda pinchada siempre y cuando tengas un gato.
Podremos ir de camping la próxima semana a no ser que no esté diluviando.
No podrá venir a la fiesta de despedida de Tim si no hace las paces con Susan
No podrán aprobar el exámen aunque estudien toda la noche.
No podré hacer ejercicio a menos que Peter me devuelva mi bici.
Como se dejó su disfraz en casa, no podrá ponérselo.
¿Podrá él ganarle a ella si no juega bien?
Si nadie te ayuda a recoger todo este lío, ¿Podrás recogerlo tú solo?
¿Podrá la gente volverse invisible en algún momento en el futuro?
¿Crees que Javier podrá ir a la fiesta de presentación del libro de Bill?

Data.Title: Future Going to
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Afirmative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + vb to be  + going to (gonna) + verb infinitive</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Negative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + vb to be  + not + going to (gonna) + verb infinitive</color>
R03:<color=#5bd3de>Question:</color><color=#c9e8ff> vb to be  + 'Suj' + going to (gonna) + verb infinitive + '?'</color>
R04:<color=#5bd3de>Plans:</color><color=#c9e8ff> Use for the intention to do something</color>
R05:<color=#5bd3de>Predictions:</color><color=#c9e8ff> Predictions about weather or things that happens without our control.</color>
R06:<color=#5bd3de>Arrangement or near Plans:</color><color=#c9e8ff> We use present continuos for that</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:I'm going to call you tonight.
R01:She is going to be late.
R01:They are gonna be happy to see you.
R02:I'm not going to call you tonight.
R02:She isn't going to be late.
R02:They aren't going to be happy to see you.
R03:Are you gonna call me tonight?
R03:Is she going to be late?
R03:Are they going to be happy to see you?
R04:We are going to have a party tonight!
R04:Richard is going to take an English class.
R04:I’m going to clean my room tonight.
R05:It doesn’t look like we’re going to sell any ice cream today.
R05:It's not gonna raing today, I hope so...
R06:Sarah is coming next thursday.
R06:I'm going to the doctor this afternoon.
SpanishExamples: Voy a llamarte esta noche.
Va a llegar tarde
Van a estar felices de verte
No voy a llamarte esta noche.
No va a llegar tarde
No van a estar felices de verte
¿Vas a llamarme esta noche?
¿Va a llegar tarde?
¿Van a estar felices de verte?
¡Vamos a dar una fiesta esta noche!
Richard va a dar clases de inglés
Voy a limpiar mi habitación esta noche.
Parece que no vamos a vender ningún helado hoy.
No va a llover hoy, espero..
Sarah viene el próximo jueves
Voy al doctor esta tarde

Data.Title: Future Will
Data.Description: Use to decide something at the moment of speaking or Predictions
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Afirmative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will + verb (contraction: she'll /I'll / They'll...)</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Negative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will + not (won't) + verb</color>
R03:<color=#5bd3de>Question:</color><color=#c9e8ff> Will  + 'Suj' + verb + '?'</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:The door’s bell rings, I’ll get it.
R01:That looks heavy, I'll help you.
R01:I’ll be with you in a minute.
R01:We’ll keep an eye on everything
R02:I think she won’t mind if you ask her about that!
R02:We won't accept the terms of this contract.
R02:Tommy, I am sorry I will not help you with your homework. I am too busy right now.
R03:When will they come?
R03:Will you open the door for me, please?
R03:What will happen?
SpanishExamples: El timbre suena, iré a abrir.
Eso parece pesado, te ayudaré.
Estaré contigo en un minuto.
Estaremos pendientes de todo
No creo que le importe si la preguntas sobre eso!
No aceptaremos los términos de este contrato.
Tommy, lamentablemente no te ayudaré con la tarea. Estoy demasiado ocupado en este momento.
¿Cuándo vendrán?
¿Quieres abrirme la puerta, por favor?
¿Qué pasará?

Data.Title: Will Probably
Data.Description: Uses when there is an element of doubt.
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Afirmative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will + probably + verb infinitive</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Negative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will + not (won't) + probably + verb infinitive</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:I’ll probably go.
R01:It'll probably rain.
R01:She’ll probably forget.
R01:We’ll probably go with you.
R02:We probably won’t go to the meeting.
R02:She probably won’t even think about it.
R02:You probably won’t have time.
SpanishExamples: Es probable que vaya
Es probable que llueva
Probablemente lo olvidará.
Es probable que te acompañemos.
Es probable que no vayamos a la reunión.
Es probable que ni se le ocurra.
Es probable que no tengas tiempo.

Data.Title: Future Perect Simple
Data.Description: An action will happen before another action in the future or in a specific time
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Afirmative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will  have + vb past participle</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Negative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will + not (won't) have + vb past participle</color>
R03:<color=#5bd3de>Question:</color><color=#c9e8ff> Will  + 'Suj' + have + vb past participle + '?'</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:The party will have ended by the time you finish work.
R01:I’ll have eaten before we meet.
R01:I will have been in London for six months by the time I leave.
R01:By the time I finish this course, I will have taken ten tests.
R02:We won’t have become fluent in English by the time we leave for Mexico next month.
R02:I won’t have done the dishes by the time we have to leave home.
R03:Will you have perfected your English by the time you come back from the U.S?.
R03:Will she have learned enough Chinese to communicate before she moves to Beijing?
SpanishExamples: La fiesta habrá terminado para cuando termines el trabajo
Habré comido antes de reunirnos.
Habré estado en Londres 6 meses para cuando me vaya.
Para cuando termine este curso, habré hecho 10 tests.
No vamos a tener fluidez en español antes de irnos a México el mes que viene.
No habré lavado los platos para cuando tengamos que irnos de casa.
¿Habrás perfeccionado tu Inglés para cuando vuelvas de US?
¿Habrá aprendido suficiente Chino para comunicarse antes de mudarse a Beijing?.

Data.Title: Future Perect Continuous
Data.Description: Action will continue up until a particular event or time in the future.
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Afirmative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will  have been + vb ing</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Negative:</color><color=#c9e8ff> 'Suj' + will + not (won't) have been + vb ing</color>
R03:<color=#5bd3de>Question:</color><color=#c9e8ff> Will  + 'Suj' + have been + vb ing  + '?'</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:Francis will have been living in Italy for 4 years by the time he finishes his studies.
R01:We will been working for 24 hours by the time we finish this project.
R01:Jessica will have been studying English for 5 years when she moves to England next April.
R02:By this time of the year They won´t have been travelling for over a year.
R02:When I go to the shop, by her own good I expect She won’t have been using my bike.
R03:Will you have been living together for long before you get married?
R03:Will you have been waiting for more than two hours when her plane finally arrives?
SpanishExamples: Francis habrá estado viviendo en Italia 4 años para cuando termine sus estudios.
Habremos estado trabajando durante 24 horas para cuando hayamos terminado este proyecto.
Jessica habrá estado estudiando inglés durante 5 años, hasta que se haya trasladado a Inglaterra el próximo abril.
Para este momento del año No llevarán viajando más de un año.
Cuando vaya a la tienda, por su propio bien espero que no habrá estado usando mi bici.
¿Habréis estado conviviendo durante mucho tiempo antes de os hayáis casado?
¿Habrás estado esperando más de dos horas cuando el avión llegue por fin?
